payload.raw: Rendering and Styling
The render surface
StreamMDX exposes two major customization surfaces:

inline.text: StreamMDX exposes two major customization surfaces:

payload.raw:
- `components` (block-level rendering)
- `inlineComponents` (inline rendering)
You can override individual blocks without losing incremental rendering. This is how you wrap code blocks, tables, or math without breaking the stream.

inline.text: You can override individual blocks without losing incremental rendering. This is how you wrap code blocks, tables, or math without breaking the stream.

payload.raw: Block-level overrides

payload.highlightedHtml:
import { StreamingMarkdown } from "stream-mdx";
import { ScrollAreaHorizontal } from "@/components/ui/scroll-area";

const components = {
  code: ({ html }) => (
    <pre className="not-prose rounded-lg border border-border">
      <ScrollAreaHorizontal className="min-w-auto">
        <div className="min-w-max p-4" dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: html }} />
      </ScrollAreaHorizontal>
    </pre>
  ),
};

export function StyledCode({ text }: { text: string }) {
  return <StreamingMarkdown text={text} components={components} worker="/workers/markdown-worker.js" />;
}

payload.raw: This wraps the existing optimized code rendering inside a scroll container while keeping the patch pipeline intact.

inline.text: This wraps the existing optimized code rendering inside a scroll container while keeping the patch pipeline intact.

payload.raw: Inline overrides
Inline overrides let you swap tags for specific inline nodes:

inline.text: Inline overrides let you swap tags for specific inline nodes:

payload.highlightedHtml:
const inlineComponents = {
  code: ({ text }: { text: string }) => (
    <code className="inline-code rounded bg-muted px-1">{text}</code>
  ),
  link: ({ href, children }: { href?: string; children: React.ReactNode }) => (
    <a className="markdown-link underline" href={href} target={href?.startsWith("http") ? "_blank" : undefined}>
      {children}
    </a>
  ),
};

<StreamingMarkdown text={content} inlineComponents={inlineComponents} />

payload.raw: Tables with ShadCN
Table rendering can use custom elements:

inline.text: Table rendering can use custom elements:

payload.highlightedHtml:
import { Table, TableBody, TableCell, TableHead, TableHeader, TableRow } from "@/components/ui/table";

const tableElements = {
  Table,
  Thead: TableHeader,
  Tbody: TableBody,
  Tr: TableRow,
  Th: TableHead,
  Td: TableCell,
};

<StreamingMarkdown text={content} tableElements={tableElements} />

payload.raw: This swaps table tags without changing how the renderer schedules updates.

inline.text: This swaps table tags without changing how the renderer schedules updates.

payload.raw: HTML overrides
When `features.html` is enabled, HTML blocks can be mapped onto custom components:

inline.text: is enabled, HTML blocks can be mapped onto custom components:

payload.highlightedHtml:
const htmlElements = {
  table: ({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) => (
    <div className="rounded border border-border overflow-x-auto">{children}</div>
  ),
};

<StreamingMarkdown text={content} htmlElements={htmlElements} features={{ html: true }} />

payload.raw: HTML overrides (ShadCN-style wrappers)
If your content includes raw HTML, you can wrap it with ShadCN primitives while keeping streaming intact:

inline.text: If your content includes raw HTML, you can wrap it with ShadCN primitives while keeping streaming intact:

payload.highlightedHtml:
const htmlElements = {
  table: ({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) => (
    <div className="rounded-lg border border-border overflow-x-auto">{children}</div>
  ),
  blockquote: ({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) => (
    <blockquote className="border-l-2 border-border pl-4 text-muted-foreground">{children}</blockquote>
  ),
};

<StreamingMarkdown text={content} htmlElements={htmlElements} features={{ html: true }} />

payload.raw: Typography and spacing
The docs site uses two layers of styles:

inline.text: The docs site uses two layers of styles:

payload.raw:
- `.markdown-v2-output` for streaming-specific tweaks
- `.markdown` and `.prose` for base typography
You can disable or replace these styles in your own app. The component itself does not inject CSS, so you control the look completely.

inline.text: You can disable or replace these styles in your own app. The component itself does not inject CSS, so you control the look completely.

payload.raw: Optional Tailwind theme package
If you want the docs styling without copying CSS, install the optional theme package:

inline.text: If you want the docs styling without copying CSS, install the optional theme package:

payload.raw:
```bash
npm install @stream-mdx/theme-tailwind
```
payload.highlightedHtml: npm install @stream-mdx/theme-tailwind

payload.raw: Then import the stylesheet after your Tailwind directives:

inline.text: Then import the stylesheet after your Tailwind directives:

payload.highlightedHtml:
@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

@import "@stream-mdx/theme-tailwind/theme.css";

payload.raw: The theme ships `.markdown-v2-output`, `.markdown`, and `.prose` helpers. Use `@tailwindcss/typography` if you want the `prose` base styles.
Recommended structure

```tsx
```
payload.highlightedHtml:
<div className="prose markdown">
  <StreamingMarkdown className="markdown-v2-output" text={content} />
</div>

payload.raw: This pattern keeps markdown typography consistent while still using the streaming renderer.

inline.text: This pattern keeps markdown typography consistent while still using the streaming renderer.
